metadata.synopsis: Player and Minthara wake up in a private room at the Elfsong tavern, having spent the night together after saving the city and destroying the netherbrain. Minthara is a little bit upset that the player didn't seize control of the brain and become the new Absolute, but she's in love with them and forgives them. And then dreams about their next conquests.

38.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
38.text: The world wakes to a new dawn, and we are here to greet it.
38.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

118.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
118.text: The world wakes to a new dawn, and we are here to greet it.
118.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
6.text: Not as conquerors, but as saviours.

113.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
113.text: Saviours of a city that we must now leave forever.

41.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
41.text: I thought your mind had evolved, not degraded. Do you not see? No matter our deeds, we both have the semblance of villains now.

45.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
45.text: The people we saved will not thank us. They will hunt us, and kill us.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I should have taken control of the brain when I had the chance.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I am leaving, but not with you. We need to go our separate ways.

117.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
117.text: After all that we have done together, you would leave me now?

83.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
83.text: I want to go where you go.

62.text: The world wakes to a new dawn, and we are here to greet it.

0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
0.text: The world wakes to a new dawn, and we are here to greet it.

121.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
121.text: Not as conquerors, but as saviours.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Doesn't it feel good to know that we did the right thing?

15.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
15.text: But despite everything we gave up when we destroyed the brain, it is good to be here with you.

104.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
104.text: Your body is gone, but your mind is more beautiful than ever. Before, I could hold all that you are in my thoughts.

71.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
71.text: Now, I mourn the loss of the tadpole, because I can only imagine the wonders it could show me if our minds locked together as they once did.

3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
3.text: So am I, my love. Let us be monsters together.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Where do you suggest we go?

102.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
102.text: I can think of one place that would be a natural home for us both.

36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
36.text: Perhaps it is time for my homecoming. An exile from Lolth and her mind flayer consort, leading a conquering horde on Menzoberranzan.

90.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
90.text: The battle would be legendary, and our kingdom would be magnificent.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Whatever I am - whatever I become - I need to figure it out alone.

58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
58.text: You do not ever need to be alone.

98.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
98.text: Stay with me one more day. Let me see all that you are, and I will show you what I believe we can be.

59.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
59.text: Your mind may be too powerful a thing for me to change, but I shall try.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: So you'll stay with me, and have a mind flayer as a consort?

81.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
81.text: In time, you will learn to master your form, and then you will be perfection.

17.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
17.text: No higher power can command or restrain us - we will assemble an army of thralls, and who then will be able to stand against us?

96.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
96.text: Perhaps now we can make our own destiny.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: We can still conquer using our own strength and wits.

99.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
99.text: No more gods or monsters, no devils or demons to manipulate our fate.

74.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
74.text: We reclaimed our freedom, though everything was against us. What would you do with it?

19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
19.text: We're heroes - let's enjoy the adulation of the people.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: We're heroes - let's enjoy the adulation of the people.

107.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
107.text: Ugh, the people. They could have been our subjects if we had only seized power when we had the chance.

100.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
100.text: Perhaps they still can be. Gratitude is an easy thing to exploit, and Baldur's Gate owes its continued existence to us.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: We should visit your family in Menzoberranzan.

110.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
110.text: Yes, that would be good. I'm sure my mother has missed me - she likes competition.

28.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
28.text: We can put the Gondians back to work, rebuild the Steel Watch, and march on the Underdark with an unstoppable army at our back, and a song of conquest on our lips.

42.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
42.text: It will be a glorious homecoming, and you will make a beautiful monarch, ruling by my side.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: With Gortash dead, Baldur's Gate needs new leadership.

8.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
8.text: I would have preferred to claim the whole world when we had the chance, but Baldur's Gate is not a bad place to start.

75.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
75.text: We can put the Gondians back to work, rebuild the Steel Watch, and march to Waterdeep with an unstoppable army at our back, and a song of conquest on our lips.

82.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
82.text: The Sword Coast will be our battlefield, and Baldur's Gate will be the founding city of a new dynasty.

2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
2.text: My name belongs to my mother, so our House will have a new name - your name - and the world will learn to fear it.

111.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
111.text: But we can look to the future tomorrow... or the day after. Today, let us think only of ourselves in this moment. We have won a lifetime together.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Whatever we do, let's do it far from here.

40.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
40.text: A shame to go to all the effort of saving the city if we do not seize it, but rebuilding will be a formidable task.

101.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
101.text: Chult, Thay, Amn, Waterdeep... there is a world of wonders to discover, and boundless Realms to conquer.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Freedom feels hollow. I regret not seizing control of the brain.

91.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
91.text: As do I. But smile, my love, there are yet more worlds to conquer. Perhaps it is time for my homecoming.

29.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
29.text: *Your engine screeches and grinds within your chest; the inferno is here - and there's no holding it back.*

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *Your engine screeches and grinds within your chest; the inferno is here - and there's no holding it back.*

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I think there's only one road left for me to travel. My engine's cooked. It's time.

84.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
84.text: No, Karlach. I will not lose you - not today.

48.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
48.text: The engine can endure in Avernus - we can return there, together, and make Zariel regret ever laying eyes on you.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Concentrate. Try to contain the inferno threatening to consume you from within.

16.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
16.text: You have endured so much, Karlach, and survived it all. You need not endure this pain in silence.

11.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
11.text: I know what is happening. The engine is failing. You are dying.

87.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
87.text: I will not let that happen. I hoped we might be able to enjoy the spoils of the city, but we must return to Avernus at once.

109.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
109.text: We will make Zariel sorry she ever laid eyes on you.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I can't let you do that, Minthara. You deserve a better life than Avernus can offer.

44.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
44.text: Do not presume you know what I do and don't deserve. I have chosen you - and I will have what is mine.

39.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
39.text: Come, my darling. We have a realm to conquer.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: All right - if you're by my side, I can bear it.

76.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
76.text: Whatever you cannot bear, I can take from you.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I can't. I swore I'd never go back, and I meant it.

95.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
95.text: Zariel is the last of your tormentors who lives. I will find her and punish her, whether you follow me or not.

89.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
89.text: Would you have me navigate the hells without a guide?

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You're impossible. I love you. All right - let's go.

37.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
37.text: Good. We have faced so much together already - it is only right we test ourselves against an archdevil and her legions.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: No, Minthara. I'm sorry. It's my time. All I want is to see the sky one last time before I go.

22.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
22.text: All of your strength, all of your passion... all of your fire. Extinguished. Such a waste.

105.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
105.text: I will never understand it, and I do not accept it. But if this is what you choose, I will stay with you until the end.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I'm sorry - I should have taken control of the brain.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: It would have felt like serving Bhaal again. I am free.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I was afraid I wouldn't be able to handle all of that power.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Nobody should have that much power.

5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
5.text: I think you are wrong. Given what you have become, there is nothing we can not do together.

80.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
80.text: Perhaps you are right. This may be for the best.
